I'm not sure if anyone has ever brought this up, but when I check my scoreboard in game I like to have it mirrored (Top -Top, Mid - Mid, etc.) The only feature that doesn't allow that is the teammate bubbles that are either on the side of your screen or above your mini map. 

It would be a cool idea to have the teammate bubbles mirrored so that players can see who is dead. For example, if the enemy jungler and top get killed, their grayed out icon should be mirrored above the allied jungler and top laner.  Just a thought, it would be a really cool feature to have!
I'm a fan of this idea.
I don't think it's too much to ask Riot to consider this. It would definitely make it a lot easier for low elo Junglers to know who's down so they can make smarter decisions.

Just choose one thing and stick with it or just revert him. Cause at this point it seems like a revert would be the best thing for him over seeing him being forced into whatever someone is feeling at the time.

They need to revert him back to the true Galio! 
I miss the flying golden taunt monster bomb.

Welp guess no matter how much feedback Aurelion Sol mains gave to you, you still went into with the changes. Changing him to be a more popular instead of the dedicated few is just going to create a Skarner 2.0
So the Asol mains don't want him to be popular?

Asol is all about positioning to have his balls (giggity) hitting as many champs as possible at all times.

This removes that and just turns him into another typical burst mage. Stun, press W for ball burst, back off.

It completely kills his unique identity and just makes him another "why play x champ when y is the same but better?"
The why play X champ argument is exactly what I felt when playing him on PBE. Hes just worse than every other burst-type mage out there and has higher risk.
If he has to compete with burst mages as a burst mage then that's the problem right there. He's not a burst mage and shouldn't be a burst mage

That is what I am saying...they are giving him windows of damage instead of the slow and steady burn. It is just going to hurt him in the long run because he doesn't have the burst to compete. League right now doesn't favor long, drawn out fights anymore.

When i first saw the change i didnt get it but after reading the comment of adding counterplay early to allow him to be buffed late made me understand the reasoning for the changes .... But then i thought hold on ... so hes going to be another scaling mage .... then thats again commenting back on yours... why play him over another champion? A lot of champs do the same thing now the only reason we choose them is design and how they do it ... 

They did the same to Azir ... Before his rework Riot asked for removal of mobility to keep range or remove range to keep mobility... A lot of azir mains chose to remove mobility in favour of range .... What do they do ... ignore the majorty (assuming majorty because comments on reddit and boards) They chose to keep the mobility and remove range which fixed nothing about him at all ... just made him a dumbed down version of what i liked ... no longer feels like an emperor commanding to me .. more like basic solider.... Its frustrating tbh and i feel sorry for Asol mains ..

Only hope is that it gets reverted i feel like releasing him and hearing feedback from peopleoutside of PBE is what is needed

No the problem is that these changes are to try to get more playerbase to Aurelion Sol, just as they did with Skarner back in the day. Its probably  going to bring the same problems: Aurelion Sol mains/player will feel alienated with the rework, and new players wont play him anyway

Didn't know Asol mains were against these changes. I'm curious as to why. W change seems to give the player a way to demonstrate expertise, and the passive changes seem to reduce the feelsbad situations at the cost of some damage. They seem like pretty positive changes to me, but I don't main Asol.

You completely missed the E changes, which include the MS bonus when travelling in a straight line, which makes him a valuable roamer. Additionally, making the stars remain during CC while reducing damage just kills the skill cap that dodging CC skills made so valuable on him.
No Asol main wanted this..........
It's dumb, they wanted him to feel more like a caster/mage but the cool thing about him has always been how weird he is.

These changes are generally nerfs to his entire kit and playstyle. Longer roam cooldowns, less general mobility and lane pressure, significantly reduced up time on his main and almost only source of damage, nerfs to his base values with little to no compensation.

He can't compete with the mid lane assassins or mages at all. What is the point of this champion?

I get that they said in the patch notes: "We're making Aurelion Sol more vulnerable to counterplay in the early game so that we have room to buff his scaling and presence in the late game..." but they DIDN'T buff his late game at all. Are they planning to let him be 'meh' until they can come up with meaningful buffs?

What is the point of this? No one is going to play him over someone even like Syndra. Higher damage, less risk, what is the point?
Aurelio. Sol changes are really bad. Why create unique champions just to remove their niche. He was one of the coolest designs in all of MOBAs. Now he's just another burst mage

The Aurelion Sol change to his W was a huge mistake. Considering that that ability was his best chance at staying useful in a team fight and taking that from him after a mere 3 seconds is just so confusing. Someone in a game I was in /all chatted "report sol he's trolling" because he thought I was turning off my W during team fights on my own since he didn't read the patch notes. I do enjoy the pro's associated with the patch like greater movement speed in all areas and how early game you can pretty much fly bot and be there in 5 seconds but at the cost of his dps when he actually gets there is a huge con...not sure that was a good idea. 

If you're just trying to make him more vulnerable in the early game, increase mana cost in his W so that Sol's cant just sit near a bush, cast W to clear waves instantly then gank a lane. I can see why that is OP in higher elo games but an increase in cost can hopefully assure a Sol to stay in lane till they can get a ROA to begin looking elsewhere. Also, as a mini buff, let his stars do microdamage to towers. Sols don't stay in lane too because of how miserable of a kit he has for sieging objectives and is FORCED to help other lanes. A small damage amount can give some peace of mind to Sol players that if they dominate their lane, then it's okay to stay in lane and not look to gank losing lanes and jeopardize their lead since they can focus on finishing their tower.
